Photo by tookapic

It’s very much the week after the WordCamp before this week, with the Genesis community well represented, but there’s still a lot going on in This Week in Genesis (#30), including:

  • A fantastic thank you note (and milestone) from Sridhar,
  • New theme sneak peeks from Brian Gardner, Simple Pro Themes and PIXL Designs,
  • WordPress 4.4 released,
  • Latest articles and news from around the community,
  • Your designs showcased,
  • And a WordCamp US mini round-up.

WordCamp US

First up, meetup! To all the good Genesis people that made WordCamp US, I hope you had a blast 🙂

Great #genesiswp meetup at #wcus! @RianRietveld @dreamwhisper @MikeHale @andrea_r pic.twitter.com/xpMG8fyDPc

— carrie dils (@cdils) December 5, 2015

The #GenesisWP crowd at #wcus pic.twitter.com/OX9EdccWda

— Mike Hale (@MikeHale) December 5, 2015

#wcus #genesiswp meetup @ hard rock philly. pic.twitter.com/lDKHK5IJKD

— Alex (@alx2k5) December 4, 2015

And apparently there was some swag too…

@studiopress Thanks for #genesiswp meetup support at #wcus Awesome fun. @cdils @RianRietveld @andrea_r pic.twitter.com/ekhvPYmZ4N

— Matt Ryan (@MattRy) December 7, 2015

We've got a bit of a swag thing happening here! Thank you!! #genesiswp #WCUS Great face to face time! pic.twitter.com/xjqPADTCAY

— Cathi (@BeTheBreeze) December 5, 2015

And there was also a presentation by the Genesis community’s Andrea Rennick on WordPress: Changing Lives. Sadly that one hasn’t made it up on WordPress.tv yet, but as soon as I see it I’ll post it in a future edition.

WordPress 4.4 released

Next up, it’s not a massive deal, but as Julia and others have pointed out there seem to be some minor CSS issues in the Genesis admin page if and when you update to WordPress 4.4.

I actually updated GenesisWP.guide to 4.4 before reading the tweets about it, but – while I can confirm there are minor CSS issues in the admin screens (misalignment of some elements) – there is nothing that would seemingly stop you managing your site.

A fix is already in the works, but in the meantime you might want to delay updating if you think it’s going to bother you or, perhaps, a client whose site you’re managing.

#GenesisWP users, you might want to hold off on updating #WordPress to 4.4. There are some CSS issues in the Genesis admin.

— Julia Sydnor (@PixelFrau) December 9, 2015

Themes

Latest update from Brian Gardner on his forthcoming Digital Pro child theme design for StudioPress.

Decided to lighten things up a bit on this design — https://t.co/GYY3acMdFk #genesiswp

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) December 7, 2015

Update from the guys at Simple Pro Themes on their new Sunshine Pro theme.

Archive page looks boring? Not in Sunshine Pro Genesis Theme – Soon at https://t.co/GDGEUaNdWN #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/qjAPxoztTP

— Simple Pro Themes (@SimpleProThemes) December 10, 2015

Another peek at the forthcoming Exodus theme from PIXL Designs.

New screenshot of Exodus Theme for you. Building our first theme on #genesiswp has been so hard and so rewarding. pic.twitter.com/RIrH84Zx2V

— PIXL Designs (@pixldesigns) December 6, 2015

Plus, a new theme coming soon from Wes Straham over at Appfinite (perhaps even by the time you’re reading this).

I'm working on another #genesiswp theme. Hopefully I have it ready tomorrow!

— Wes Straham (@WesStraham) December 11, 2015

Showcase

Nice customistaion of the Agency Pro theme by StudioPress from RoadWarrior Creative for thepinkmoose.net

New #genesiswp #website and #logodesign went live last night #wordpress pic.twitter.com/gtIWjNBskm

— RoadWarrior Creative (@roadwarriorwp) December 9, 2015

…Cristina Sanz shares a nice customisation of the Natalie theme, for thenavagepatch.com

Toca enseñaros otra bonita web con el tema Natalie. Another pretty website with Natalie theme #genesiswp #WordPress pic.twitter.com/sDy8xn394v

— Cristina Sanz (@LovelyConfetti) December 9, 2015

…Nick Wilmot with a new site for terryvirgo.org

Delighted to have launched a new site for @TerryVirgo: https://t.co/09FwtNyKtH – Such a profoundly insightful man! #wordpress #genesiswp

— Nick Wilmot (@nickwilmot) December 11, 2015

Best of the rest

Nice article from Matthew Snider on his warm welcome from the Genesis community. Plus, some recommended resources and people to follow.

Learning From The Best – The Genesis Community – https://t.co/EEXRf1oHyf #GenesisWP

— Matthew Snider (@matthewfsnider) December 10, 2015

Dave Dean with an update on Musket Theme, his development framework for Genesis.

#reactjs is working in #genesiswp via Musket https://t.co/47M88tz3wv. Just need to package up a demo and hit release…

— Dave Dean (@wpmusketeer) December 8, 2015

I confess, I’ve not tried this yet, but the experimental among you might want to take a look. A new homepage builder plugin for Genesis from Black Studio.

Ever wondered how to build a #GenesisWP widgetized homepage without coding skills? Check our new plugin https://t.co/Vgi2wZjEX0

— Black Studio (@blackstudioita) December 8, 2015

That all round good egg, Greg Rickaby, has updated his Genesis Sample theme.

Used #5ftf time today to update my Genesis Sample theme. Now includes Bourbon and PostCSS support! #GenesisWP https://t.co/jLBA4caWLq

— Greg Rickaby (@GregRickaby) December 7, 2015

Following on from her well received debut theme, Elise, Susan Ramsey’s now working on another Genesis theme.

I have 8 vacation days left this year. I'm thinking of taking the time off & wrapping up dev of my 2nd child theme. #happycamper #genesiswp

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) December 8, 2015

Calvin launched a new Genesis project on Medium last week and he’d love to have your contributions.

Share your #genesiswp blog posts on Medium. Here's how — https://t.co/nJgjjJj0UK

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) December 9, 2015

Plus, a whole load of updates from Restored 316.

And finally…

Fantastic thank you note from Sridhar Katakam, as he reveals he’s now reached $10,000 a month in revenue from his membership site.

(And if you want to know HOW he reached that milestone, the 44 comments he received as a result of the article should give you a clue…)

Congrats Sridhar!

(And, if you missed it, check out the interview he gave this site back in May, not long after he started the paid membership).

A Thank You Note. https://t.co/i6pX8HuGSn #GenesisWP

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) December 4, 2015

That’s all for this week. I’ll be back with another update next Friday and after that we’ll be taking a little Christmas and New Year break.

But if I can drag myself away from the festivities long enough, I’ve got some exciting new features planned for GenesisWP.guide coming into the new year.

Have a great weekend and see you next week.

PS Want to be a GenesisWP.guide beta tester? If you’d like a sneak peek at some of the new features I mentioned – and don’t mind getting your hands dirty helping me test stuff – drop me a note and I’ll add you to my list.
